result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan Richard Scholz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nathan Richard Scholz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nathan Richard Scholz was found guilty of Criminal Trespass to Dwelling [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
To run current with 14CF194.
Defendant to report to Probation today February 5, 2015 no later than 12:00 p.m.
Defendant eligible for expungement upon successful completion of Probation but must petition the Court.
Court notes 2 days credit on each count if revoked.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF474.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF474.
Not to use or possess firearms.

-Victim Empathy Seminar through Restorative Justice, to commence within 60 days.
-No Contact with Mr. Rundquist, his family or residence.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Follow through and complete any recommendations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be converted into a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan Richard Scholz

TO ALSO INCLUDE 14CF474 and 14CF194:
CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Liddle. ,ADA:  Kevin H. Gehler   DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski   DF:  Nathan Richard Scholz appeared. Case called at 3:10 p.m. ADA Gehler states recommendations. State will not take a position on expungement. Victims are present. No issues with either party that Judge knows one of the victims. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for 14CF194 count 1 pleads GUILTY court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea adjudicates def guilty of count 1. 14CF474 defendant pleads GUILTY to Count 2 Criminal Trespass. ADA Gehler states restitution in the amount of $5,565. Court finds defendant guilty in Count 1, 14CF194 and Count 2 in 14CF474. Count 1 and 3 in 14CF474 are dismissed. Victim gives statement. Atty Kucinski makes statement and is asking for expungement consideration. 
Court orders:

- 14CF194 S/W 3 years probation. 1 years probation on 14CF474 to run concurrent with 14CF194. Report to probation no later than noon on 02-05-2015. 2 days jail credit on each count if probation revoked.
- Court costs on 14CF194 of $268 and $250 DNA. 14CF474 $243 and $200 DNA. Payable through DOC
- Restitution in the amount of $5,565 payable through DOC
- Victim Empathy Seminar through Restorative Justice. Start within 60 days. 
- Condition of Probation:  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA and follow through
- Follow through and complete with any recommendations by probation agent
- Pay any supervision fees as directed by DOC
- Eligible for expungement if completes probation successfully
- Not to use or possess firearms.
- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Mr. Rundquist or his family or  residence .  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Filed by Assistant District Attorney Kevin Gehler.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 4, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Kevin H. Gehler, DF ATTY: John A. Kucinski, DF: Nathan Richard Scholz appeared.  Court called at 8:58 p.m.  Includes case 14CF474 (Set for Prelim) & 14CF194 (Set for Plea/Sentencing).  DE waives the Preliminary hearing on 14CF474. Court finds that DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court binds the DE over for trial.  Attorney Kucinski requests to set 14CF474 & 14CF194 for plea/sentencing hearing.  Bond continues in form and amount.  Court adjourned at 9:02 a.m. lw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Danielle R., Steven R. or  L.E.R. or residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
